Pre-Game Insights: The West Indies have emerged as a dark horse contender with a quality squad full of experienced cricketers, who bring a wealth of T20 experience.
Papua New Guinea will hope to register a few positive results in this World Cup, led by Tony Ura and Charles Amini.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be played at the Providence Stadium in Guyana.
The weather report for June 2, 2024, is not mentioned in the article, but the pitch report suggests that the Providence Stadium in Guyana is spin-friendly.
Others: The West Indies directly qualified for the World Cup as one of the hosts, while Papua New Guinea went unbeaten in qualifying for the event, winning six matches on the bounce.
